name: Veggie Pinto Bean Fajita Tacos with Cilantro Chile Marinade - Vegan Fajitas
description: Veggie Pinto Bean Fajita Tacos with Cilantro Chile Marinade. Amazing Fajita Marinade for veggies and Beans. Vegan Gluten-free Soy-free Vegetarian Fajita Recipe. Easily doubled.

video.name: PINTO BEAN FAJITA TACOS WITH CILANTRO CHILE LIME MARINADE | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Bean Veggie Fajita Tacos with Cilantro Chile Lime Marinade. 
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2017/01/pinto-bean-fajitas-with-cilantro-chile-lime-marinade.html

Easy tacos filled with marinated veggies and beans. This cilantro chile lime marinade is versatile and addictive. Zingy, cilantroey and flavorful. The marinade works wonderfully with any beans, tempeh, meat/chikin subs and veggies. 30 Minute Vegan Lunch!


Blend up the marinade. Marinate the beans and veggies for a few minutes. Cook them in a skillet to sear, fill up your tortillas, add toppings and done. This recipe is easily doubled, which you must, because believe me about that marinade. You will want to put it on all kinds of beans and veggies and drizzle more of it on tacos and wraps. 

This recipe is Nut-free, Soy-free. Serve as bowl over greens or with gluten-free tortillas to make gluten-free. 


BUY MY COOKBOOK: http://www.veganricha.com/vegan-richas-everyday-kitchen

recipeIngredient: 3 tbsp chopped onion or scant 1/4 cup chopped onion
a generous dash of black pepper
1 tbsp or more fresh lime juice
15 oz can pinto beans or other beans or chickpeas (drained and washed or 1.5 cups cooked)

recipeInstructions.text: Blend all the ingredients under marinade in a small blender until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend all the ingredients under marinade in a small blender until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, add the sliced veggies. Add half of the marinade and toss well. In another bowl add the beans and the remaining marinade and toss well. Let sit in the refrigerator for 15 mins to half an hour.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, add the sliced veggies. Add half of the marinade and toss well. In another bowl add the beans and the remaining marinade and toss well. Let sit in the refrigerator for 15 mins to half an hour.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add a tsp of oil. Remove veggies from the marinade and add to the skillet. Cook until tender. Add a dash of chipotle pepper powder for smokyness towards the end. Cook a min longer to sear the veggies. Transfer to a bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add a tsp of oil. Remove veggies from the marinade and add to the skillet. Cook until tender. Add a dash of chipotle pepper powder for smokyness towards the end. Cook a min longer to sear the veggies. Transfer to a bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the beans and the marinade into the same skillet. Add any leftover marinade from the veggie bowl as well. Cook over medium heat until the marinade thickens. Taste and adjust salt and spice.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the beans and the marinade into the same skillet. Add any leftover marinade from the veggie bowl as well. Cook over medium heat until the marinade thickens. Taste and adjust salt and spice.

recipeInstructions.text: Assemble the fajita tacos with warmed tacos or tortillas, generous helping of the grilled veggies and sizzling beans. Add some salsa, avocado slices or guacamole, a dash of black pepper, and lemon juice. Serve hot!
recipeInstructions.name: Assemble the fajita tacos with warmed tacos or tortillas, generous helping of the grilled veggies and sizzling beans. Add some salsa, avocado slices or guacamole, a dash of black pepper, and lemon juice. Serve hot!
